intro: Lacunaria colonensis, commonly known as the coastal lacunaria, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is often found in dune environments. Due to its unique adaptations to coastal conditions, it plays an important role in stabilizing dune ecosystems.
